Data Organization in Spreadsheets and R 0.9.1
  • Syllabus
  • Slides
  • Resources

Additional Resources / Readings

File and Folder Organization

  • “Tools for Reproducible Research: Organizing projects; exploratory data analysis”
    • notes for lecture 6 of Karl Broman’s Tools for Reproducible Research course
  • “naming things”
    • slides from Jenny Bryan on naming files and folders (see also the Reproducible Science Curriculum GitHub organization)
  • “Packaging Data Analytical Work Reproducibly Using R (and Friends)”
    • paper from Ben Marwick, Carl Boettiger, and Lincoln Mullen on structuring projects as Research Compendia, with examples of varying complexity

Tabular Data

  • “Tidy Data”

    • paper from Hadley Wickham on a framework for tabular data (see also Chapter 12, “Tidy Data” in R for Data Science)

  • Best Practices for Using Google Sheets in Your Data Project - blog post on making Google Sheets easy to work with during data entry and processing, as well as data analysis later

  • “Ten Simple Rules for Digital Data Storage”

    • paper from Ted Hart et al. on principles for structuring data and data management

Importing Data into R

  • Reading and Writing CSV Files
    • Software Carpentry’s lesson on reading and writing CSV files
  • RStudio’s import tools
    • Guide for importing data using RStudio
  • googlesheets4
    • R package for interfacing with Google Sheets
  • readxl
    • R package for interfacing with Excel files

Contents
